author: Chris Davie
title: Hector Bellerin tops Barcelona’s summer shortlist
text:
Hector Bellerin is wanted by Barcelona. (Arsenal FC via Getty Images) Hector Bellerin has been put at the top of Barcelona’s shortlist ahead of the summer transfer window, according to reports in Spain.
AS report that Barca’s technical director Robert Fernandez has met with the right-back’s representatives in London, and the defender is now aware that his former club will make their move this summer.
It’s also claimed that Barca held talks with Bellerin’s agent several months ago as they seek a long-term successor at right-back after Dani Alves’ departure last summer.
Barcelona are also aware of Manchester City’s interest in the 21-year-old, and his contract which runs until 2023 will make him a difficult target to sign.
Barcelona have held talks with Bellerin’s representatives. (Getty Images) Bellerin joined Arsenal as a 16-year-old from Barcelona’s La Masia academy and has quickly established himself as the team’s first-choice right-back.
Bellerin also issued an apology to Arsenal fans after the 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich which confirmed the club’s exit from the Champions League on Tuesday evening.
‘I am really hurt because to see the fans leave the stadium so early,’ he told the club’s official website.

‘At the end of the day we play for them, want them to be happy, to be behind us, and it hurts to see them leave so early.
‘We have to say sorry to the fans because we want to do better than that. We just need to try to make them happy with the rest of our season.’
